original_title: D-Day to Berlin: A Newsnight Special
overview: George Stevens's remarkable film is acclaimed by historians as the most important colour footage taken during the war. Milestones covered include the liberation of Paris, the link-up between the Russian and American armies on the River Elbe and the Allied capture of the Dachau concentration camp.
tagline: Documentary acclaimed as the most important colour footage taken during WWII
title: D-Day to Berlin: A Newsnight Special
